title: Signs and symptoms of diabetes, explained | JUST THE FAQs
description:
Over 37 million people in the U.S. have diabetes and that number is climbing. Here are the signs and symptoms.

RELATED: This new diabetes drug could be a game changer for obesity https://bit.ly/3WRyzck

Diabetes is expected to surge dramatically in young people over the next several decades in what experts say should be a wake-up call to prioritize health in America.

Researchers estimate that in 2060, there could be as many as 220,000 people under age 20 with Type 2 diabetes, an increase of nearly 700%, according to a Centers for Disease Control and Prevention study released Thursday. Those with Type 1, the most common type in young people, could see a 65% increase.

Overall, the findings estimate that more than half a million young people could have diabetes in 2060, if current rates continue and with population increase. In 2017, that number was 213,000, according to the study published in American Diabetes Association's Diabetes Care.

title: How to Reduce Fasting Blood Sugar | Diabexy
description:
✅ What to Eat & Avoid in Diabetes? Download EGL Chart at Rs. 1/- Only- https://diabexy.com/products/diabexy-egl-chart-download  
 
✅ Book a FREE diet consultation with our Certified Diabetes Reversal Coach visit

How to Reduce Fasting Blood Sugar | Diabexy Talk Show on Diabetes Ep 02

🙏🏻 We are thankful to our subscribers who regularly watch and comment on our videos. After watching the videos, people generally have many quires which they put in the comment box regarding diabetes. This program is designed to answer those quires. Therefore, Diabexy brings you the show "Diabexy Talk Show on Diabetes" Here, we will answer your questions precisely, debunk many diabetes-related myths, and raise awareness about the condition. You may please ask your questions by clicking on the above link and submitting your queries.  

🤔 Why does fasting blood sugar decrease slowly? 

The reason fasting blood sugar decreases gradually is that blood sugar levels do not remain constant in the body. Our body follows a circadian rhythm, and this internal clock resets around 4 AM. This reset allows the pancreas to capture the circulating insulin and clear the blood sugar. As the liver pulls in this insulin, the pancreas starts pumping fresh insulin. This process doesn't have a significant impact on blood sugar levels. However, in diabetic patients, the pancreas is weakened. While the liver continues its function of pulling in the excess insulin, the pancreas fails to release fresh insulin. This leads to a decrease in insulin levels in the body, while the level of glucagon, which is insulin's opposite, increases. Glucagon then converts the fat stored in the liver into sugar, releasing new glucose into the bloodstream and causing blood sugar levels to rise.

title: Frequent Urination and Thirst | Diabetes Symptoms #shorts #shortsvideo #diabetes
description:
In this video, we will discuss the prominent symptoms of #diabetes, focusing on excessive urination and constant thirst. If you find yourself peeing frequently and feeling thirsty all the time, it could be a sign of diabetes. Stay tuned to learn more about these common warning signs and how to manage them. Remember, early detection is key to effectively managing diabetes and maintaining your overall health. Watch now to stay informed about diabetes symptoms

High Blood Sugar Levels: In diabetes, the body either does not produce enough insulin (Type 1 diabetes) or cannot effectively use the insulin it produces (Type 2 diabetes). This leads to elevated blood sugar levels (hyperglycemia). The kidneys attempt to remove the excess glucose from the blood by filtering it out into the urine. This excess glucose in the urine pulls water along with it, leading to increased urine production (polyuria).

Dehydration: Increased urination can result in dehydration, which triggers the sensation of thirst. The body tries to replenish lost fluids by making you feel thirsty.
#Diabetes #FrequentUrination #HighBloodSugar #DiabetesSymptoms #HealthTips

title: 10 Best DAILY Foods for Diabetes Type 2 Patients SHOULD Eat DAILY | Best Foods for Diabetics
description:
Learn more a list of the best foods for type 2 diabetic patients to eat daily. This diabetes food list should be tailored specifically to what your body needs in your diabetes diet.  We’re going to show you some of type 2 diabetes-friendly foods and snacks that you can choose from. These should include fruits, vegetables, whole grains, protein, and healthy fats. Eating these healthy foods not only improves your health but also helps ease the symptoms of diabetes. 

✅  NOTE ✅ 
Please note that while the foods listed in this video may be beneficial for individuals with diabetes, it is important to consume them in moderation and as part of a healthy, balanced diet. We recommend consulting with a healthcare professional or registered dietitian to determine the appropriate amount of these foods for your individual dietary needs.

============================
❤️ SECRET from FORMER Diabetics
HERE: https://healthtipsinfo.site/reverse-diabetes
============================

This is a list of the best foods for diabetic patients to eat daily, including:

1. Olive oil
There is a big misconception that if you have type 2 diabetes, you cannot have any fats in your diet. This is false because unsaturated fats are essential for a person with type 2 diabetes.

2. Nuts & Seeds
Frequent nut and seed consumption can reduce the risk of developing type 2 diabetes. This is because they are high in fiber, protein, and healthy fats, which can help control blood sugar levels.

3. Eggs
Eggs and other protein-rich foods can be an important part of a diet for people with diabetes. They can help regulate blood sugar levels and prevent severe spikes in the short term. 

4. Peanut Butter
One of daily foods for diabetes is peanut butter. Some people find that peanut butter is an excellent substitute for refined carbohydrates like white bread and sugar. 

5. Green Vegetables
People with diabetes should eat more green vegetables like spinach, cabbage, or kale, to reduce their risk of developing complications associated with diabetes.

6. Cinnamon
Some research has found that cinnamon can improve insulin sensitivity and reduce blood sugar levels in people who have type 2 diabetes. 

7. Dark Chocolate
Dark chocolate is one of the best type 2 diabetes foods to eat daily. 

8. Beans and lentils
Beans and lentils have a low GI, meaning they release their sugars into the bloodstream slower than most other foods. 

9.  Brown rice
Brown rice is a whole grain that provides fiber and some vitamins and minerals. White rice is a refined grain that has fiber and many minerals removed, making it softer. 

10. Avocado
Avocado contains monounsaturated fatty acids, which are good for managing blood sugar levels and insulin resistance. 

That's a roundup of some of the best foods for diabetic patients to eat to maintain a healthy lifestyle and take care of diabetes.

What Is Diabetes?
Diabetes is a condition that happens either when your pancreas does not produce or manufacture enough insulin or when your body cannot effectively utilize the insulin it stimulates.

Hyperglycemia (increased blood sugar) is the most common effect of uncontrolled diabetes. Over time, it leads to serious damage or disease to many of the organs and systems in your body, especially the nerves and blood vessels.


Diabetes Can Be Of Three Types Depending On Age And Other Factors:

Type 1 diabetes (occurs in infants),
Type 2 diabetes (occurs in adults)
Gestational diabetes (occurs in women at the time of pregnancy).


These are the top 10 warning signs of diabetes:

- Frequent Urination
- Frequent Thirst
- Frequent Hunger
- Unexplained Weight Loss
- Fatigue
- Difficulty In Vision
- Slow-Healing Cuts And Wounds
- Frequent Infection
- Numbness Or Tingling In Your Hands Or Feet
- Discoloration Of Your Skin

Take Away: For Diabetes Patients
---------------------------------------------------------------
- Diabetes is a metabolic disease that occurs when your body does not produce enough insulin or cannot effectively use insulin.
- It is a major cause of mild to severe diseases like blindness, kidney failure, heart attacks, stroke, and lower limb amputation in many populations.
- Diabetes is a treatable disease, and its significance can be prevented or discontinued with diet, physical activity, medication, and regular screening and treatment for severe complications.
- Significant warning signs and symptoms are early detectable, which can be very helpful in the early diagnosis and treatment of diabetes.
- The three main warning signs of diabetes are frequent urination, frequent thirst, and frequent hunger.

title: Diabetes Remission Vs Diabetes Reversal | Diabexy
description:

✅ Book a FREE diet consultation with our Certified Diabetes Reversal Coach ➡ Visit https://appointment.diabexy.com/#/customer/free-diabetes-consultation 

✅ Diabetes Remission Vs Diabetes Reversal 

In this informative video, we delve into the critical differences between diabetes remission and diabetes reversal. Many individuals are often confused about these terms, but understanding them is crucial for managing diabetes effectively.

Diabetes remission refers to a state where blood sugar levels are controlled without the need for medications or insulin. This can be achieved through significant lifestyle changes, such as adopting a healthy diet, regular exercise, and weight loss. However, it's important to note that diabetes can still return if these lifestyle changes are not maintained.

On the other hand, diabetes reversal goes beyond remission. It signifies a state where the body's insulin production and sensitivity are restored to a level where diabetes is no longer present. This is often achieved through intensive lifestyle interventions, such as very low-calorie diets or bariatric surgery, which can lead to substantial weight loss and significant improvements in insulin function.

In this video, we'll explore the strategies for both remission and reversal, including the challenges and benefits associated with each approach. Whether you're living with diabetes or supporting someone who is, understanding these concepts can empower you to make informed decisions about managing the condition and improving overall health.

10 Foods Diabetics Should NEVER Eat (Avoid Them At All Costs)!
description:
People with diabetes need to be mindful of their diet because certain foods can significantly impact blood sugar levels. Here are 10 Foods Diabetics Should Never Eat (Avoid Them at All Costs) as much as possible. Here's why:

✔️ Blood Sugar Control: Diabetes disrupts the body's ability to regulate blood sugar (glucose). 

✔️ Insulin: People with type 1 diabetes don't produce enough insulin, a hormone that helps cells absorb glucose for energy.

✔️ Insulin Resistance: In type 2 diabetes, the body becomes less responsive to insulin, meaning glucose can't enter cells effectively.
Food Impact:

✅ Carbohydrates: These break down into glucose, the primary source of energy for the body. Consuming too many carbs can cause a rapid spike in blood sugar.

✅ Sugary Foods: Processed foods, sugary drinks, and sweets are high in added sugars, leading to significant blood sugar fluctuations.

✅ Unhealthy Fats: Saturated and trans fats can increase insulin resistance and contribute to heart disease, a common complication of diabetes.

I hope you learn much from this video and begin to avoid them for better blood sugar management. Get our UNDO DIABETES GUIDE here 👉 https://www.cooperwellnesscenter.com/books.

title: Diabetes নিয়ে এতো ঘ্যান- ঘ্যান কেন? । Dr Kunal Sarkar | 5 tips for diabetes patient
description:
If you are a diabetes patient, remember these tips that can help you prevent and control diabetes. #medicalandhealth #medicalhealth #medicalhealthtips #medical_and_health #healthtipsshorts #healthtipsforhappylife  

#1 Take medicines regularly
You should take your diabetes medicines regularly as prescribed by your doctor. This will help to keep your blood sugar levels in control.

#2 Do a regular heart check-up
Diabetes can increase your risk of heart disease. So, you need to do a regular heart checkup.

#3 Have a proper diet
You should have a proper diet and eat healthy foods such as vegetables, fruits, whole grains, and lean protein. Avoid eating sugary and fatty foods.

#4 Walk regularly
Walking is a great exercise for diabetes patients. It helps to lower blood sugar levels and also improves your overall health.

#5 Be physically active
You should be physically active for at least 30 minutes per day. Exercise can help to lower your blood sugar levels.

#6 Monitor your blood sugar levels
You should monitor your blood sugar levels regularly. This will help you to know if your treatment plan is working or not.

#7 Consult your nearest doctor
If you have any concerns about your health, you should consult your nearest doctor. He/she will help you to manage your diabetes in a better way.

These are some tips that can help you in preventing and controlling diabetes.

title: Control Diabetes Naturally | The Health Show | Himanshu Bhatt #shorts
description:
Diabetes is a disease that occurs when your blood glucose, also called blood sugar, is too high. Blood glucose is your main source of energy and comes from the food you eat. Insulin, a hormone made by the pancreas, helps glucose from food get into your cells to be used for energy. Sometimes your body doesn’t make enough—or any—insulin or doesn’t use insulin well. Glucose then stays in your blood and doesn’t reach your cells.

#diabetes #health

title: Complete Guide to Type 2 Diabetes Reversal | The Diabetes Code Clinic (Part 3)
description:
Hi, I’m Dr. Jason Fung, and welcome to Part 3 of the Diabetes Code Clinic, where we focus on reversing Type 2 diabetes through proven methods. If you missed Parts 1 and 2, I recommend watching those first, as we discussed what Type 2 diabetes is and introduced the low carbohydrate diet.

In today’s video, we’re diving deeper into the low carbohydrate diet and why it’s one of the most effective approaches for reversing Type 2 diabetes. The key to managing this disease lies in understanding how blood glucose levels are affected by what you eat. Using tools like the glycemic index and glycemic load, you can identify foods that raise your blood sugar and those that don’t.

You’ll learn:
✔️ Why cutting carbohydrates is essential for managing diabetes
✔️ The difference between refined and natural carbohydrates
✔️ How foods like vegetables, proteins, and healthy fats can stabilize blood sugar
✔️ Easy swaps and practical tips to stick to a low-carb diet
✔️ What happens if your blood sugar drops too low—and how to handle it

▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬  
Timestamps for Easy Navigation:
⏱️ 00:00 Topics to be covered today
⏱️ 00:27 Low carbohydrate diet
⏱️ 01:20 Foods that raise or don’t raise blood glucose
⏱️ 03:21 Glycemic index of foods
⏱️ 06:44 Reports on low-carb diets
⏱️ 08:50 Very low carbohydrate foods
⏱️ 09:17 What to eat on a very low-carb diet?
⏱️ 10:27 What if my blood glucose goes down?
⏱️ 10:59 Ending
▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬  

Key Points:
✅ Type 2 diabetes occurs when the body is overwhelmed with glucose, causing blood sugar levels to rise.
✅ A low carbohydrate diet targets the root cause—excess glucose—by reducing sugar intake and prioritizing foods that don’t spike blood sugar.
✅ Using tools like the glycemic index (GI) and glycemic load, you can make informed choices about what to eat.
✅ Refined carbs (like bread and cornflakes) spike blood sugar, while natural carbs (like carrots and cauliflower) have a much lower impact.
✅ Incorporating low-carb, high-protein foods such as chicken, beef, eggs, and non-starchy vegetables can significantly improve blood glucose levels.

Tips for Following a Low-Carb Diet:
1️⃣ Choose Whole Foods: Focus on natural, unprocessed foods.
2️⃣ Fill Your Plate Smartly: Half with non-starchy vegetables, half with proteins.
3️⃣ Try Low-Carb Substitutes: Use lettuce wraps, cauliflower rice, or konjac noodles instead of bread and traditional pasta.
4️⃣ Monitor Your Blood Sugar: If you’re on diabetes medication, consult your doctor to adjust dosages as needed.

Benefits of a Low-Carb Diet:
📉 Reduces blood sugar levels and HbA1c
⚖️ Promotes weight loss
💊 Reduces dependency on diabetes medications
✔️ Scientifically backed by organizations like the American Diabetes Association (ADA) and the American Heart Association (AHA)

Why Watch This Video?
If you or a loved one is struggling with Type 2 diabetes, this video provides actionable insights to start reversing the disease naturally. By following a low-carb lifestyle, you can regain control over your health and reduce the need for medications.

Don’t forget to like, comment, and subscribe to stay updated with more health and diabetes management tips. Hit the notification bell so you never miss out!

📢 Share Your Journey:
Have you tried reversing Type 2 diabetes? Let us know your experience in the comments below. Dr. Fung and the community would love to hear from you!

=============================  
📌 BOOKS:

👉 The Diabetes Code - Reviewing how type 2 diabetes is a reversible disease and dietary strategies. https://www.amazon.com/dp/B0795BLS8D?...

title: 🤔 Did you know that Metformin & other diabetes medications can deplete your body...
description:
🤔 Did you know that Metformin & other diabetes medications can deplete your body of three crucial nutrients?

👉 Vitamin B12 is essential for cellular energy, and without it, your energy levels can drop.
👉 Folate, or folic acid, is key for DNA synthesis and cell repair, so a lack of it hinders healing and proper cell function.
👉 Coenzyme Q10, or CoQ10, is vital for muscle strength and energy, and its depletion can cause muscle weakness, pain, and fatigue.

I am so passionate about this topic because rates of insulin resistance, pre-diabetes, and diabetes have absolutely skyrocketed in our country – and so have the perscriptions for these medications.

But the reality is there are so many natural, holistic techniques you can use to battle sugar-related disease. 

If you want to learn about my top tactics to battle insulin resistance at a LIVE virtual, comment HEAL to join me and Dr. Will Cole on August 12th for our free event A Day to Heal.

You don't have to stay dependent on medication. Share this with someone you know who is struggling with one of these diagnoses.

title: LOW blood sugars terrify me 🧃 #t1d #typeonediabetes #diabetes #lowbloodsugar #youtubeshorts
5 Self Care Routines to Heal your Body and Mind #shorts #diabetes
description:
5 self-care routines to heal for people with diabetes:

Workout first thing in the morning to get glucose under control: I find that working out first thing in the morning without insulin works the best to not only control my blood glucose throughout the day but also prevents any lows

Mindfulness practice & breathing exercise: I find meditation and or breathing exercises like yoga help tremendously with mental health

Counting carbs precisely: I like to think of counting carbs as self care because it keeps your blood glucose in control after meals. Doing so will prevent diabetes burnouts

Treat your cuts and burns with @Lavior Diabetic first aid gel: It is important to take care of wounds living with diabetes. First aid gel is formulated to prevent infection and relieves pain and itch. It gives relief and promotes healing of cuts, scrapes, burns, sunburns.

Heal your dark marks from diabetes devices with Lavior Diabetic wound dressing: It creates optimal environment for wound healing and promotes skin regeneration. I like to apply the wound dressing to the red marks right after site change.

#skincare #diabetes #type1diabetes #typ2diabetes #diabeteseducation #diabetesawareness

title: The Impact of Diabetes on Eye Health - Know How Diabetes Can Affects Your Eyes #centreforsight
description:
The Impact of Diabetes on Eye Health : Diabetic retinopathy, a prominent cause of vision loss and potential blindness, underscores the importance for individuals with diabetes to be vigilant about these conditions and proactively manage their eye health.

If you're diabetic, taking extra care of your eyes is essential. Here's what you need to know:

1️⃣ Annual Eye Check-Up:
Even if your vision seems normal, ensure you get a comprehensive eye exam every year, especially focusing on your retina.

2️⃣ Watch for Symptoms:
Be alert for signs like:

Blurred or distorted vision
Spots or floaters
Difficulty seeing straight lines clearly
If you notice these, schedule an eye check-up immediately.

3️⃣ Early Treatment is Crucial:
Diabetic eye damage often starts mild but can progress to severe stages.

Disclaimer:
This content from Centre For Sight is for general information only and not medical advice. Always consult a licensed eye doctor for any eye health concerns after a proper check-up. High Protein Food for Diabetic Patients | Control Diabetes | Egg Curry | Dr. Ravikanth Kongara

--*****--
గత 12 సంవత్సరాలుగా రెండు తెలుగు రాష్ట్రాల ప్రజలకి అత్యాధునిక ప్రమాణాలతో సరికొత్త ఆధునిక వైద్య సేవలని డాక్టర్ కొంగర రవికాంత్  గారు అందిస్తున్నారు. విజయవాడలోని వారి కర్పోరేట్ స్థాయి హాస్పటల్లో తమ విశేష అనుభవంతో సామాన్యులకి కూడా అందుబాటులో ఉండే నాణ్యమైన వైద్య సేవలు అందిస్తూ గొప్ప పేరు సాదించారు. 

అన్ని రకాల గ్యాస్ట్రో, బేరియాట్రిక్ సర్జరీ, లాపరోస్కోపీ సమస్యలకి చికిత్స అందిస్తూ దక్షిణ భారతదేశంలోనే నెలకు అత్యధిక బేరియాట్రిక్ సర్జరీలు చేస్తు గొప్ప ఫలితాలు సాదించారు. అంతేగాక 200 నుండి 250 కిలోల కంటే ఎక్కువ బరువున్న అత్యంత ప్రమాదకర బేరియాట్రిక్ సమస్యకి శస్త్రచికిత్స చేసి అసాధ్యాన్ని సుసాధ్యం చేసారు. సుమారు 200 కిలోల కంటే ఎక్కువ బరువున్న సూపర్ ఒబేసిటీ పేషెంట్లు మంచి ఫలితాలని పొందారు. 

విజయవాడలో మొట్ట మొదటిసారిగా విదేశి తరహాలో అత్యాధునిక సౌకర్యాలతో 24 గంటలు వైద్యుల పర్యావేక్షణలో వైద్య సేవలు అందిస్తున్నారు. 100 పడకలతో పాటు అత్యవసర సమయంలో ఆంబులెన్స్ సౌకర్యం కలదు. 

Dr. Ravikanth Kongara MBBS, MS, DNB(Gastro-NIMS)
Ravi Hospital, Bariatric, gastro, laparoscopy, Swathi Press - opp Kovelamudi Street, Suryaraopeta, Vijayawada - 2, Andhra Pradesh: 520002, Phone: 0888 183 8888, 888 184 8888.

Dr. Bhagyesh Kulkarni, a leading Preventive Cardio-Diabetologist, is revolutionizing diabetes care in India through his “Diabetes Free Forever” program. With over 17 years of experience and expertise in lifestyle-related disorders, Dr. Kulkarni shares his holistic approach to reversing Type 2 diabetes and improving overall health.

In this podcast, we dive deep into the root causes of diabetes, the role of lifestyle changes, and practical steps for prevention and reversal. Topics include:

1. The connection between COVID-19 and chronic diseases.
2. Early symptoms and essential tests for diabetes detection.
3. Diet recommendations, including safe starches, zero-calorie sweeteners, and diabetes-friendly desserts.
4. The effectiveness of intermittent fasting and detox diets.

title: Why ADHD, Autism, and Diabetes Have Skyrocketed
description:
Our children are being fed toxic chemicals, ultra-processed junk, and excessive sugar—all under the guise of “nutrition.”

The science is clear: many of the additives found in school meals are linked to cancer, reproductive harm, hormone disruption, and DNA damage. They serve no nutritional purpose—only to extend shelf life, enhance color, and modify texture.

Meanwhile, childhood obesity has increased by 400% in the last 40 years. Type 2 diabetes in adolescents has surged 200% in just two decades. 1 in 4 teenagers has prediabetes. ADHD diagnoses have skyrocketed 800%, and autism rates have gone from 4 in 10,000 to 1 in 36.

This isn’t normal. This isn’t genetic. This is a food problem.

Europe bans thousands of chemicals we allow in our food. Why aren’t we asking why?

Our kids deserve better. That’s why I’m fighting for SB 314, a bill that bans some of the worst chemicals from public school meals—because no child should be forced to eat food that puts their health at risk.

It’s time to wake up. Food is the root cause of our crisis—and it must be the solution.

Should a diabetic prefer walking or gym exercise?
description:
Both walking and gym workouts are beneficial for diabetes management, but they serve different purposes. Here’s how you can balance both for better blood sugar control and overall health.

🚶‍♂️ Walking & Stair Climbing After Meals – A Must for Diabetics!
🔹 Why? After eating, blood sugar levels tend to rise. Light activity like walking or stair climbing helps:
✔️ Lower post-meal blood sugar (PPBS) naturally
✔️ Improve insulin sensitivity
✔️ Enhance digestion and prevent glucose spikes

💡 Best Practice:
✅ Walk for 10-15 minutes after each meal or do 2-5 minutes of stair climbing (even 3 flights of stairs help!).
✅ Walking before bed can prevent overnight sugar spikes.

🏋️‍♂️ Gym Exercise / Yoga – Strength Training is a Game Changer!
🔹 Why? Gym workouts or yoga for 40-60 minutes daily can:
✔️ Build muscle (muscles absorb glucose better than fat)
✔️ Burn extra sugar and stored fat
✔️ Improve metabolism and reduce insulin resistance

💡 Best Routine:
✅ Strength Training (3-4x per week) – Use weights or bodyweight exercises like squats, lunges, and push-ups.
✅ Yoga & Flexibility (2-3x per week) – Improves insulin function and reduces stress.
✅ HIIT or Cardio (1-2x per week) – Short bursts of high-intensity workouts help regulate blood sugar fast.

🏆 Best Exercise Plan for Diabetics
🔹 Daily: Walk for 10-15 min after meals OR do stair climbing
🔹 Once a day: Gym exercise OR Yoga for 40-60 min
🔹 Mix both: Walking + Strength Training + Yoga/Cardio is the best combo!

🚀 Conclusion:
Both walking and gym workouts are essential! Do post-meal walks or stair climbing daily and dedicate 40-60 min to either gym or yoga for long-term diabetes control.

title: Is papaya or papita safe for diabetes patients?
description:
Is Papaya (Papita) Safe for Diabetes Patients?
✅ Yes, papaya is safe for diabetics when consumed in moderation. It has moderate carbohydrates and a low glycemic index (GI) of around 60, meaning it won’t spike blood sugar drastically. However, portion control is key!

📌 Why Is Papaya Good for Diabetics?
🍈 Moderate Carbohydrates – A 100g serving of papaya contains 11g of carbs, which is lower than many high-GI fruits like bananas or mangoes.
🌿 Rich in Fiber – Papaya contains 2.5g of fiber per 100g, which helps slow down sugar absorption and prevents sudden glucose spikes.
🛡️ Antioxidants & Vitamins – It is packed with vitamin C, A, and flavonoids, which support immune function and reduce inflammation.

⚠️ How Much Papaya Can a Diabetic Eat?
🔹 Stick to 100-150g per serving (about a small bowl or 3-4 medium slices).
🔹 Avoid eating papaya with other high-carb foods to prevent a blood sugar spike.
🔹 Best time to eat? As a mid-morning snack or post-meal dessert with protein/fat to slow down sugar absorption.

🥇 Is Guava Better Than Papaya for Diabetics?
✅ Yes! Guava is a better choice because:
✔️ Lower glycemic index (~24-40) than papaya
✔️ Higher fiber (5.4g per 100g), making it even better for blood sugar control
✔️ More vitamin C, which helps in reducing oxidative stress in diabetics

If you are choosing between papaya and guava, guava is the better option for diabetics due to its higher fiber and lower sugar content.

🛑 Avoid Papaya If:
🚫 You consume too much fruit in one sitting (excess carbs = blood sugar spikes)
🚫 You have poorly controlled diabetes or insulin resistance
🚫 You eat it along with high-GI fruits like mango, banana, or dates

✅ Final Verdict: Should Diabetics Eat Papaya?
🔹 Yes, in moderation! Papaya is a good fruit choice but should be eaten in safe limits.
🔹 Guava is a better alternative due to its higher fiber content and lower glycemic impact.
🔹 Always monitor blood sugar levels after consuming fruit to see how your body responds.

💬 Which fruit do you prefer—papaya or guava? Let us know in the comments!

title: How To Reverse Diabetes Naturally ?
description:
Want to know how to reverse diabetes naturally? Here are 3 powerful strategies to manage blood sugar levels effectively.

 1. Food Sequencing: Eat your veggies first, followed by protein and fats, and save carbs for last. This helps control blood sugar spikes by slowing down carb absorption, which keeps insulin levels steady.
 2. Exercise and Weight Training: Regular exercise, especially weight training, is key to improving insulin sensitivity. By building muscle, you help your body use glucose more effectively and reduce blood sugar levels naturally.
 3. Use a CGM (Continuous Glucose Monitor): A CGM patch helps you track your blood sugar in real-time, so you know exactly which foods trigger spikes and which keep you stable. This personalized insight can be a game-changer in managing diabetes.

Watch until the end to learn how these simple habits can transform your health journey!

description:

✔️ Los verdaderos enemigos de la glucosa
✔️ La tríada Glucosa - Insulina - Triglicéridos

🗓️ Martes 1 de abril | ⏰ 8 PM MEX | 9 PM COL

🎁 BONO: Regístrate y recibe GRATIS una guía de los carbohidratos de mejor calidad para tu salud.

👉🏼 Reserva tu lugar aquí: http://bit.ly/4kPzLd7


___

La avena es rica en fibra, especialmente en fibra soluble, que ayuda a regular el azúcar en sangre y a mejorar la digestión. La fibra soluble puede ralentizar la absorción de glucosa, lo que puede ser beneficioso para las personas con diabetes.

El índice glucémico es una medida de cuán rápido un alimento aumenta el nivel de glucosa en sangre. Los alimentos con un IG bajo se digieren y absorben más lentamente, lo que puede ayudar a controlar los niveles de azúcar en sangre. La avena integral tiene un IG moderado, por lo que puede ser una opción adecuada para las personas con diabetes, siempre que se consuma con moderación y se sigan algunas pautas.

Betaglucanos y su impacto en la salud

Los betaglucanos son un tipo de fibra soluble presente en la avena, que se ha relacionado con beneficios para la salud cardiovascular y el control de la glucosa en sangre. Estudios científicos han demostrado que los betaglucanos pueden ayudar a reducir el colesterol LDL (colesterol malo) y a mejorar la sensibilidad a la insulina, lo que podría ser beneficioso para las personas con diabetes.

Recomendaciones para consumir avena en caso de diabetes

Evitar la avena instantánea: La avena instantánea de Quaker, por ejemplo, suele tener menos fibra que la avena integral. Opta por avena integral, que es menos procesada y contiene más fibra.

Asegurarse de que sea integral: La avena integral debe tener un aspecto más oscuro y menos uniforme que la avena refinada.

Acompañar con grasas saludables o proteínas: Combinar la avena con grasas saludables (como nueces o almendras) o proteínas (como yogurt griego) puede ayudar a reducir su índice glucémico y a mantener estables los niveles de azúcar en sangre.

Evitar la fruta cocida: La fruta cocida puede aumentar el IG de la avena, por lo que es mejor evitarla.

Elegir versiones sin azúcar: Algunas marcas de avena ofrecen opciones sin azúcar. Asegúrate de elegir estas opciones para evitar un consumo excesivo de azúcares.

Combinar con ingredientes adecuados: Mezcla la avena con leche vegetal, nueces, almendras, frutos rojos o fresas para obtener un desayuno equilibrado y nutritivo. También puedes combinarla con chía y dejarla remojando para potenciar sus beneficios.

Evitar la avena refinada: La avena también puede estar refinada, lo que disminuye su contenido de fibra y aumenta su índice glucémico. Opta por la avena integral siempre que sea posible.

Tener cuidado al cocinar la avena: Cocinar la avena puede elevar su índice glucémico. Considera remojarla en agua o yogurt griego en lugar de cocinarla.

Consumir avena con moderación: A pesar de sus beneficios, la avena sigue siendo una fuente de carbohidratos. Si tienes diabetes, es importante consumirla con moderación y ajustar su ingesta según tus necesidades nutricionales y los consejos de tu médico o dietista.

Evitar ciertos tipos de avena: Algunas variedades de avena, como la granola, suelen contener azúcares añadidos, grasas y frutos secos en exceso. Estos ingredientes pueden aumentar su índice glucémico, por lo que es mejor evitarlos.

Ser creativo con recetas saludables: Puedes preparar hot cakes de avena con huevo, o incluso un pastel de zanahoria saludable usando avena integral. Esto te permitirá disfrutar de la avena de diversas maneras sin comprometer tu salud.

title: HbA1c Test For Diabetes In Telugu || Dr. Deepthi Kareti
description:
1.Does walking reduce HbA1c?
walking is effective in decreasing HbA1c, by an average of 0.50% (95% CI, 0.70–0.21%), in diabetic patients.

2.Is HbA1c 7.0 normal?
For people without diabetes, the normal range for the hemoglobin A1c level is between 4% and 5.6%.

3.What are the tips to lower HbA1c levels?
 Lose extra weight,Eat a balanced, healthy diet, Get more physical activity. Exercise can help to lose weight, lower blood sugar and boost sensitivity to insulin
Limit alcohol intake and Quit smoking.

4.Do I need to fast for a HbA1c test?
  You do not need to fast for the HbA1c test.

5.What should I avoid if my HbA1c is high?
 sugar,sweets,juices and carbohydrate rich food

title: Is my BLOOD SUGAR low? 🧃💉 #t1d #typeonediabetes #diabetes #lowbloodsugar #youtubeshorts
Is Upma Good For Diabetes Patients || Dr. Deepthi Kareti
description:
1.What Are the Health Benefits of Eating Upma?
Some of the major health advantages of eating upma are as follows:

Just a bowl of upma is enough to make you feel full for quite a long time. That's because upma is a slow-digesting food that keeps cravings at bay.
Minerals such as phosphorus, magnesium and zinc in rava upma are good at improving bones, kidney function and the nervous system.
Upma is one of the best sources of iron that prevents anaemia while boosting blood circulation.
Upma is free of harmful cholesterol and thus works wonders for heart health. It maintains healthy heart pumping and proper blood flow, offering its nutritional elements.
Upma made from wheat rava contains a lot of potassium which is healthy for the kidneys.

2.Is upma good for diabetes?
Yes, Upma is good for diabetes because it is high in nutritional value and contains fibre that maintains proper blood sugar levels.

3.Can I Eat Upma Every day?
Yes, you can consume upma every day.

4.Is sooji high in sugar?
glycemic index of sooji is low, around 66, indicating a slow and steady increase in blood glucose. The low GI index of suji makes it a potentially better option for individuals with diabetes.

5.‍Is sooji good for weight loss?
Yes, sooji is recommended for people who are trying to lose weight. 100 grams of unenriched sooji consists of approximately 360 calories and no cholesterol. Moreover, the high fiber content in this ingredient can promote slow digestion of food in the body. This leads to the person feeling full for a longer duration and curbs the frequent hunger pangs and intake of food. Suji also has a lot of iron, calcium, magnesium, zinc, and other vital nutrients that help maintain energy levels within the body.

title: First Dexcom change of the year #diabetes #t1d #typeonediabetes #dexcom #dexcomg6 #expressionmed
El TRUCO para REDUCIR AZÚCAR NATURALMENTE y prevenir DIABETES
description:
¿Sabías que mantener un nivel adecuado de azúcar en sangre es fundamental para evitar múltiples enfermedades? La glucosa elevada en sangre puede desencadenar problemas de salud serios, como trombosis cerebrales, infarto, hígado graso, ansiedad, síndrome de ovario poliquístico, prediabetes, diabetes, y hasta cáncer. Controlar los niveles de glucosa es más que una necesidad; es una forma de proteger tu salud en general.

¡Baja el azúcar en sangre SIN REMEDIOS! | Diabetes tratamiento natural. Lo primero y más importante es adoptar una alimentación consciente. Eliminar de tu dieta los azúcares, jarabes, mieles y alimentos altos en almidón como arroz, papa, yuca, plátano, y pasta es esencial. Optar por carbohidratos provenientes de vegetales y consumir alimentos en un orden que priorice los vegetales puede hacer una gran diferencia.

¿Por qué es vital reducir el consumo de ciertos tipos de carbohidratos? Al consumir primero vegetales y luego proteínas, permites que tu cuerpo maneje mejor los niveles de glucosa. Si aún tienes hambre después de una comida, es mejor optar por más proteínas en lugar de carbohidratos adicionales. Este enfoque no solo ayuda a mantener los niveles de glucosa bajos, sino que también te deja más satisfecho y con menos probabilidad de tener picos de glucosa después de comer.

¿Cómo puede ayudarte el ejercicio en la regulación del azúcar en sangre? Combinar ejercicios de fuerza con cardio es la estrategia más eficaz. El ejercicio de fuerza ayuda a mejorar la capacidad de tus músculos para utilizar glucosa, lo que reduce la cantidad circulante en tu sangre. Mantener una buena masa muscular es crucial, ya que el músculo es uno de los principales consumidores de glucosa en el cuerpo.

¿Qué otros factores debes considerar para controlar tu glucosa? El manejo del estrés es fundamental. El estrés, tanto mental como físico, puede aumentar los niveles de glucosa en sangre al elevar hormonas como el cortisol y la adrenalina. Aprender a manejar el estrés eficazmente puede prevenir estos picos de glucosa y ayudarte a mantener un metabolismo saludable.

¿Existen suplementos que pueden ayudarte a manejar mejor la glucosa? Sí, algunos suplementos como el vinagre de manzana, la berberina, el inositol y el magnesio han demostrado ser útiles para mejorar los niveles de glucosa. Sin embargo, es crucial que cualquier suplemento se tome bajo supervisión médica y como complemento a una dieta saludable y un estilo de vida activo.

title: Superfoods for Type 2 Diabetes || Dr. Deepthi Kareti
description:
What food is best for diabetic patients?
Fruits and vegetables.
Whole grains, such as whole wheat, brown rice, barley, quinoa, and oats.
Proteins, such as lean meats, chicken, turkey, fish, eggs, nuts, beans, lentils, and tofu.
Nonfat or low-fat dairy, such as milk, yogurt, and cheese.

What foods reduce blood sugar?
Eating protein — from meat and fish, tofu, nuts, eggs, and cheese — with carbs can slow that flow of glucose and help stabilize blood sugar. “Proteins hold back the sugars, slow them down, and then release them into the bloodstream slowly so that your blood sugar stays in a more normal range,

Which juice is good for diabetes?
Amla Juice. Amla juice is a healthy choice for people with diabetes.
Spinach Juice
Pomegranate Juice. 
Carrot Juice.
Herbal Tea.
Tomato Juice.
Watermelon Juice.

Can diabetics eat dates?
those living with diabetes can enjoy dates in moderation.

title: Estrategias Comprobadas para Revertir la Diabetes - En Directo
description:
¡Bienvenidos a nuestra transmisión en vivo de  @HaciaunNuevoEstilodeVida ! Hoy nos dedicamos a una de las afecciones de salud más comunes y serias: la diabetes. En este directo, exploraremos todo lo que necesitas saber sobre la diabetes: qué es, cómo identificar sus síntomas, qué la causa y, lo más importante, cómo puedes revertirla.

Es fundamental destacar que tanto la sal como el azúcar en exceso pueden contribuir a elevar la glucosa en sangre. La sal aumenta la retención de líquidos, lo que eleva el volumen sanguíneo, mientras que el azúcar puede inducir cambios en el metabolismo que también afectan al páncreas.

Discutiremos las posibles consecuencias de no manejar adecuadamente la diabetes y ofreceremos consejos prácticos para su prevención y manejo. Este directo es esencial para cualquier persona que quiera entender mejor cómo la diabetes afecta la salud y cómo evitar que se convierta en un problema mayor.

¡Acompáñanos en esta conversación vital para tu bienestar!

#dralbuja #haciaunnuevoestilodevida #diabetes

title: Methi Seeds for Diabetes in Telugu || Dr. Deepthi Kareti
description:
What are the benefits of fenugreek seeds?
Fenugreek may aid metabolic conditions, such as diabetes ( 8 ). In one study, people with type 2 diabetes who took 5 g of fenugreek seed powder twice daily for 2 months experienced a reduction in fasting blood sugar levels, belly fat, body mass index, and hemoglobin A1c, a marker of long-term blood sugar control ( 9 ).

Can I use fenugreek seeds daily?
Dosing. Fenugreek seed powder has most often been used by adults in doses of 5-10 grams by mouth daily for up to 3 years. Fenugreek seed extract has most often been used in doses of 0.6-1.2 grams by mouth daily.

Does fenugreek have side effects?
Potential side effects of fenugreek include diarrhea, nausea, and other digestive tract symptoms and rarely, dizziness and headaches. Large doses may cause a harmful drop in blood sugar. Fenugreek can cause allergic reactions in some people.

Can fenugreek reduce belly fat?
Methi or fenugreek has Galactomannan, a component that helps in curbing appetite and improving metabolism. Methi also helps in digestion and promotes belly fat loss. You can add methi to stir-fries, mathris, parathas and a range of delicious dishes.

title: ENT Symptoms of Diabetes || Dr. Deepthi Kareti
description:
How does diabetes affect the ears?
Over time, high blood sugar levels can damage small blood vessels and nerves in the inner ear. Low blood sugar over time can damage how nerve signals travel from the inner ear to your brain. Both types of nerve damage can lead to hearing loss.

What is the most common ear infection in diabetics?
Malignant otitis externa and rhinocerebral mucormycosis are two head-and-neck infections seen almost exclusively in patients with diabetes.

How common is hearing loss in diabetes?
Audiogram was analyzed for hearing loss &classified by WHO criteria found that 72 % individuals with diabetes were noted to have mild SNHL ,20 % with moderate SNHL,3% moderate severe SNHL, 4 % severe ,1% with profound hearing loss .

Can diabetes cause itchy ears?
Diabetes. Certain systemic disorders, such as diabetes, make a person more prone to ear infections and itchiness. This is because diabetes makes earwax less acidic, which makes the skin in the ears more vulnerable to fungal and bacterial infections.

Can diabetics use ear drops?
Make sure you tell your doctor if you have any other medical problems, especially: Type 2 diabetes mellitus or. Epilepsy—Using otic corticosteroids may worsen this condition.

description:
Does diabetes reversal really work?
studies show it's possible for some people to reverse it. Through diet changes and weight loss, you may be able to reach and hold normal blood sugar levels without medication.

what is the diet for diabetes reversal ?
Morning breakfast with 3 millets idlies , morning snake {11:00am} 1 apple , afternoon lunch {1 cup brown rice with dhal,evening snake ragi jawa, DINNER 2 chapathies with rajma, chenna curry.
along with 30 minits waking per day

what is remission ?
Remission is depending on diet, You can take low calorie diet. 
What is the cause of glucotoxicity?

Untreated high blood sugar can lead to a condition called glucotoxicity . It's caused by damaged beta cells. Beta cells help your body create and release a hormone called insulin. Insulin pulls sugar (also called glucose) out of your blood so your cells can use it for energy.
Examples  for very low calorie food? 
Apples. beet root,Broccoli,cabbage,carrot etc.

What fruit reduces insulin resistance?

What is a good breakfast for insulin resistance?

Mr.Doctor: https://youtube.com/@mrdoctor?si=ha3Q17nFFAYLJRBu

La DIABETES MELLITUS es una enfermedad en la que las células pierden la capacidad de captar y utilizar la glucosa como fuente de energía debido a que el sistema de la
INSULINA no funciona correctamente.
La diabetes puede ser increíblemente compleja y para la que existen muchos tipos distintos cada una con sus particularidades: diabetes tipo 1, tipo 2, diabetes tipo MODY, diabetes gestacional, diabetes neonatal... ¿Qué caracteriza entonces a la diabetes? ¿Hay motivos reales para llamarla la epidemia del siglo XXI?

Los síntomas de inicio de diabetes son provocados por la inflamación en el cuerpo. Todas estas son señales de que puedes tener prediabetes: fatiga, cansancio, dolores crónicos en los músculos y articulaciones, alteraciones de la memoria y concentración, infeccion urinaria.

La diabetes y la prediabetes pueden tratarse de manera natural, y los mejores alimentos para un diabético son las frutas y verduras con efecto antioxidante y antinflamatorio como la granada, las moras, los arándanos y los frutos rojos.

title: Diabetes Mellitus - Fisiopatologia; Definição; Tipos; Exames; Diagnóstico. [Patologia]
description:
#biomedicina #patologia #diabetes 
Diabetes mellitus é uma doença crônica caracterizada pela hiperglicemia, que ocorre devido à produção insuficiente de insulina ou à resistência das células à ação desse hormônio. Existem dois principais tipos: o tipo 1, que resulta da destruição autoimune das células beta do pâncreas, e o tipo 2, relacionado à resistência à insulina e à insuficiência relativa na sua produção. O diagnóstico é feito por exames laboratoriais que medem os níveis de glicose no sangue, como glicemia de jejum, hemoglobina glicada e teste de tolerância à glicose. A fisiopatologia envolve desequilíbrios no metabolismo da glicose e disfunções nos hormônios insulina e glucagon, responsáveis por regular os níveis de glicose no corpo.

Nosso perfil no instagram: https://www.instagram.com/patologia.facil/
Nosso perfil no Tik Tok: https://www.tiktok.com/@patologia_facil?lang=pt_BR

title: Hva er diabetes?
description:
Insulin er et hormon som produseres i bukspyttkjertelen og som har som hovedoppgave å senke blodsukkeret. Insulinet fungerer som en «nøkkel» som låser opp cellene slik at glukose (sukker) kommer inn i cellene og kan brukes som energi i kroppen. 

Ved diabetes type 2, så produserer kroppen enten for lite insulin i forhold til behovet og/eller det insulinet som produseres virker dårligere i kroppen og klarer ikke å åpne opp cellene. Da blir sukkeret liggende i blodet, og fører til høyt blodsukker. 

Når man har fått diabetes type 1, så produserer ikke kroppen noe insulin og blodsukkeret blir veldig høyt. Man kan ha litt insulinproduksjon helt i starten av sykdomsforløpet, men denne produksjonen vil stoppe opp etter en tid. 
Diabetes type 1 og type 2 er to forskjellige sykdommer. Felles for dem begge er at svekket insulinfunksjon medfører høyt blodsukker og at sykdommene er kroniske.

Denne videoen er utviklet med økonomisk støtte fra Damstiftelsen.

title: Can Moringa Help Manage Diabetes? in Telugu || Dr. Deepthi Kareti
description:
Is moringa good for a diabetic?
It has been reported that there is a relation between Moringa and decreased blood sugar levels in humans, when moringa leaf powder was administered to diabetic patients, a significant reduction in blood glucose levels was recorded [35].


Is drumstick good for diabetics?
In conclusion, drumstick is a nutrient-dense vegetable that has numerous health benefits, particularly for people with diabetes. It can help lower blood sugar levels, improve lipid profile, protect against oxidative stress, and promote feelings of fullness.

How to make moringa juice for diabetes?
Take Drumstick / Moringa Leaves with 1 glass of water, and blend them together until a fine juice appears. Then, filter the juice and add lemon drops or honey to mask the bitter taste. Now, the Drumstick leaves juice is ready to drink.

Who should not eat drumstick?
People with low blood pressure, pregnant women, individuals on blood-thinning medications, or those with hypothyroidism should consult a doctor before consuming drumsticks (moringa) regularly, as excessive intake could potentially cause complications with their conditions; it's generally recommended to consume drumsticks in moderation due to potential side effects like digestive issues or blood sugar fluctuations.

description:

16:18- Importante para quem tem diabetes ou pré-diabetes!

O diabetes  tipo 2 é uma doença comum no Brasil, afeta mais de 15 milhões de pessoas. E o pré-diabetes afeta assustadores 40 milhões de brasileiros. No diabetes o corpo não produz insulina suficiente ou não usa adequadamente a insulina que produz. Insulina é um hormônio produzido pelo pâncreas e ajuda a glicose (o açúcar) a entrar nas células para fornecer energia. No mundo o índice de diabéticos está aumentando em um taxa alarmante, saltando de 108 milhões de pessoas no mundo em 1980 para incríveis 507 milhões em 2022. Felizmente há maneiras para reverter a pré-diabetes e evitar que o indivíduo o vire diabético ( e em alguns casos é possível reverter o diabetes).

Nesse vídeo, apresentamos as 5 dicas de como reverter o pré-diabetes e o diabetes tipo 2 naturalmente, além de explicar sobre os sintomas de diabetes, a relação entre obesidade e resistência insulínica e sobre exames de sangue importantes para o diabetes, como glicemia capilar, hb glicada, insulina basal, homa e curva glicêmica.

title: 9 SINAIS de DIABETES que acontecem à NOITE | PRIMEIROS SINTOMAS DE DIABETES e PRÉ-DIABETES (cuidado)
description:
9 SINAIS estranhos de DIABETES que acontecem à NOITE | PRIMEIROS SINTOMAS DE DIABETES e PRÉ-DIABETES
💕💕INSCREVA-SE:  https://bit.ly/2IUdn43​​​    
✅ COMPARTILHE o vídeo no WHATSAPP e vamos ajudar mais pessoas! 

0:00- 9 SINAIS estranhos de DIABETES que acontecem à NOITE | PRIMEIROS SINTOMAS DE DIABETES e PRÉ-DIABETES
1:05- 9 SINAIS estranhos de DIABETES que acontecem à NOITE | PRIMEIROS SINTOMAS DE DIABETES e PRÉ-DIABETES
1:19- O que é pré-diabetes?
1:59- Quais os 9 sintomas que os diabéticos sentem à noite?
2:09- 1º sintoma de diabetes à noite
3:04- 2º sinal que aparece para o diabético à noite
4:27- 3º sintoma de diabetes que acontecem à noite
5:26- 4º sinal de diabetes à noite
6:20- 5º sintoma que aparece à noite para o diabético
7:20- 6º sintoma de diabetes que aparecem à noite
8:05- 7º sintoma noturno de diabetes
8:37- 8º sintoma de diabetes que acontece à noite
9:18- 9º sintoma noturno de diabetes
10:00- Como prevenir que um pré- diabético não vire diabético?

Você sabia que o diabetes pode se manifestar de diferentes formas?
Existem sintomas muito frequentes que aparecem à noite que podem indicar que a pessoa pode estar com pré-diabetes ou diabetes inicial.  E isso tem um grande valor, porque muita gente com diabetes não sabe que tem a doença. Quanto mais cedo se descobre, melhor. 
Se a pessoa for pré-diabética pode evitar que torne diabético. E se for diabético inicial, a pessoa pode evitar que a doença complique. É importante que a glicose do sangue seja bem controlada para diminuir o risco de desenvolver complicações associadas ao diabetes.

Quando a pessoa tem diabetes, o corpo não produz insulina suficiente, que é um hormônio que faz o açúcar entrar para dentro da célula, ou não a utiliza adequadamente, sendo pouco sensível ou resistente à insulina. 

Nesse vídeo, apresentamos os 9 sintomas mais frequentes de diabetes e pré-diabetes que aparecem à noite. Então fique atento e  siga as dicas finais!

Referências
https://my.clevelandclinic.org/health/diseases/22206-insulin-resistance
https://www.niddk.nih.gov/health-information/diabetes/overview/what-is-diabetes/prediabetes-insulin-resistance
https://www.cdc.gov/diabetes/basics/insulin-resistance.html
https://www.diabetes.co.uk/insulin/insulin-sensitivity.html

description:

--*****--
గత 12 సంవత్సరాలుగా రెండు తెలుగు రాష్ట్రాల ప్రజలకి అత్యాధునిక ప్రమాణాలతో సరికొత్త ఆధునిక వైద్య సేవలని డాక్టర్ కొంగర రవికాంత్  గారు అందిస్తున్నారు. విజయవాడలోని వారి కర్పోరేట్ స్థాయి హాస్పటల్లో తమ విశేష అనుభవంతో సామాన్యులకి కూడా అందుబాటులో ఉండే నాణ్యమైన వైద్య సేవలు అందిస్తూ గొప్ప పేరు సాదించారు. 

అన్ని రకాల గ్యాస్ట్రో, బేరియాట్రిక్ సర్జరీ, లాపరోస్కోపీ సమస్యలకి చికిత్స అందిస్తూ దక్షిణ భారతదేశంలోనే నెలకు అత్యధిక బేరియాట్రిక్ సర్జరీలు చేస్తు గొప్ప ఫలితాలు సాదించారు. అంతేగాక 200 నుండి 250 కిలోల కంటే ఎక్కువ బరువున్న అత్యంత ప్రమాదకర బేరియాట్రిక్ సమస్యకి శస్త్రచికిత్స చేసి అసాధ్యాన్ని సుసాధ్యం చేసారు. సుమారు 200 కిలోల కంటే ఎక్కువ బరువున్న సూపర్ ఒబేసిటీ పేషెంట్లు మంచి ఫలితాలని పొందారు. 

విజయవాడలో మొట్ట మొదటిసారిగా విదేశి తరహాలో అత్యాధునిక సౌకర్యాలతో 24 గంటలు వైద్యుల పర్యావేక్షణలో వైద్య సేవలు అందిస్తున్నారు. 100 పడకలతో పాటు అత్యవసర సమయంలో ఆంబులెన్స్ సౌకర్యం కలదు.

title: How Vitamin D IMPACTS Your Diabetes Risk Factors Preview #shorts
description:
This is a preview for a video where Dr. Elise Brown breaks down how vitamin D impacts your diabetes risk factors. Vitamin D plays an important role in prevention and treatment of gestation diabetes, prediabetes, and type 2 diabetes  (beta cell function, insulin sensitivity, and inflammation). Learn about the health effects of taking a vitamin D supplement may have on your diabetes risk factors. This video also shows how combining vitamin D with exercise may be more effective than exercise by itself. Any changes to diet, including supplements like vitamin D, or exercise should first be discussed with your doctor.

Merchandise to help support the channel: https://www.elisebrownphd.com/shop

Connect with me: https://linktr.ee/the_diabetes_resistance_llc

Sources used:
1. E. Benedik, “Sources of vitamin D for humans,” International Journal for Vitamin and Nutrition Research, vol. 92, no. 2, pp. 118–125, Mar. 2022
2. Meuffels et al. (2022). Exercise interventions combined with dietary supplements in type 2 diabetes mellitus patients—a systematic review of relevant health outcomes. Frontiers in Nutrition, 9, 817724.
3. Contreras-Bolívar et al. (2021). Mechanisms involved in the relationship between vitamin D and insulin resistance: impact on clinical practice. Nutrients, 13(10), 3491.
4. Hilger, J et al., A Systematic Review of Vitamin D Status in Populations Worldwide. Br. J. Nutr. 2014, 111, 23–45
5. Wang, M et al., (2021). The effects of vitamin D supplementation on glycemic control and maternal-neonatal outcomes in women with established gestational diabetes mellitus: A systematic review and meta-analysis. Clinical Nutrition, 40(5), 3148-3157.
6. Mahmoud Barbarawi et al., Effect of Vitamin D Supplementation on the Incidence of Diabetes Mellitus, The Journal of Clinical Endocrinology & Metabolism, Volume 105, Issue 8, August 2020, Pages 2857–2868, 
7. Pittas, A. G., Kawahara, T., Jorde, R., Dawson-Hughes, B., Vickery, E. M., Angellotti, E., ... & Balk, E. M. (2023). Vitamin D and risk for type 2 diabetes in people with prediabetes: a systematic review and meta-analysis of individual participant data from 3 randomized clinical trials. Annals of internal medicine, 176(3), 355-363.
8. Wu, C., Qiu, S., Zhu, X., & Li, L. (2017). Vitamin D supplementation and glycemic control in type 2 diabetes patients: A systematic review and meta-analysis. Metabolism, 73, 67-76.
9. Dadrass A, Mohamadzadeh Salamat K, Hamidi K, Azizbeigi K. Antiinflammatory effects of vitamin D and resistance training in men with type 2 diabetes mellitus and vitamin D deficiency: a randomized, double-blinded, placebo-controlled clinical trial. J Diabetes Metab Disord. (2019) 18:323–31. 
10. Miller EG, Nowson CA, Dunstan DW, Kerr DA, Menzies D, Daly RM. Effects of whey protein plus vitamin D supplementation combined with progressive resistance training on glycaemic control, body composition, muscle function and cardiometabolic risk factors in middle-aged and older overweight/obese adults with type 2 diabetes. Diabetes Obes Metab. (2021) 23:938–49.

title: Diabetes symptoms in Hindi #shorts
Tips to Lower your Blood Sugar in Telugu || Deepthi Kareti
description:
Can walking reduce sugar?
Just 2 minutes of walking after eating can help blood sugar, study says. Getting up and moving after you eat -- even if it's only for two minutes -- can help control blood sugar levels,

What is the best way to control sugar?
Drinking water and staying hydrated is important for managing blood sugar, also known as blood glucose. “Water helps your kidneys filter out excess sugar through urine,” says Khan. “So, the more hydrated you are, the more urine production you'll have, which flushes out sugar in the body.”

How can I control eating sugar?
Drink a glass of water. Some people say that dehydration can cause cravings.
Eat a fruit. Having a piece of fruit may help satisfy sugar cravings for some people.
Avoid artificial sweeteners.
Eat more protein.
Talk to a friend.
Sleep well.
Avoid excess stress.

title: 5 Delicious Diabetes-Friendly Dinner Ideas in Telugu || Dr. Deepthi Kareti
description:
What are the 5 best foods for diabetics?
Oatmeal.
Dairy.
Beans.
Broccoli.
Quinoa.
Spinach.

Can diabetics skip dinner?
With diabetes, it is important to eat regular, balanced meals to help stabilize your blood sugars. 2 In the short run, skipping meals can lead to low blood sugar if you take certain medications. And later in the day, overeating to compensate for hunger can lead to high blood sugar.

What is the best food for diabetes patients?
Protein foods like beans, nuts, pulses, eggs, meat and fish
But a healthy diet means less red and processed meat – they've been linked to cancer and heart disease. Oily fish like mackerel, salmon and sardines have a lot of omega-3 oil, which can help protect the heart.

title: Diabetes Control Tips | Sugar Control Tips | Control Diabetes without Medicine | Health Show
description:
Diabetes is a chronic disease that occurs either when the pancreas does not produce enough insulin or when the body cannot effectively use the insulin it produces. Insulin is a hormone that regulates blood glucose. Hyperglycaemia, also called raised blood glucose or raised blood sugar, is a common effect of uncontrolled diabetes and over time leads to serious damage to many of the body's systems, especially the nerves and blood vessels.

In 2014, 8.5% of adults aged 18 years and older had diabetes. In 2019, diabetes was the direct cause of 1.5 million deaths and 48% of all deaths due to diabetes occurred before the age of 70 years. Another 460 000 kidney disease deaths were caused by diabetes, and raised blood glucose causes around 20% of cardiovascular deaths (1).

Between 2000 and 2019, there was a 3% increase in age-standardized mortality rates from diabetes. In lower-middle-income countries, the mortality rate due to diabetes increased 13%.

By contrast, the probability of dying from any one of the four main noncommunicable diseases (cardiovascular diseases, cancer, chronic respiratory diseases or diabetes) between the ages of 30 and 70 decreased by 22% globally between 2000 and 2019.

Fast blood sugar is below 100 mg/dl

200 mg/dl (11.1 mmol/l) or more after two hours indicates diabetes.

After meals/before bed: 80-140 mg/dL.

polydipsia, polyuria and polyphagia. 

 Which fruits raise blood sugar ?
bananas and grapes

Top 9 Best Vegetables For Diabetics to Eat! (Lower Blood Sugar)
description:
Top 9 Best Vegetables For Diabetics to Eat! (Lower Blood Sugar)

Managing diabetes effectively requires more than just avoiding certain foods—it’s about making smart dietary choices that actively support blood sugar control. For diabetics, incorporating the right vegetables into daily meals can significantly improve insulin sensitivity and overall metabolic health. Some vegetables, like Brussels sprouts, spinach, and broccoli, are rich in fiber, antioxidants, and bioactive compounds that help stabilize glucose levels.

For diabetics, vegetables like cabbage, tomatoes, and cucumbers provide essential vitamins and minerals that support heart health and reduce inflammation. Avocados, packed with healthy fats, are another excellent choice for improving insulin sensitivity and preventing blood sugar spikes. These nutrient-dense foods help diabetics regulate glucose absorption while reducing the risk of diabetes-related complications.

Choosing fresh, steamed, or lightly sautéed vegetables with healthy fats like olive oil can maximize their benefits. A well-balanced diet, along with regular exercise and stress management, is crucial for diabetics seeking stable blood sugar levels.

title: High Blood Sugar Signs in Pregnancy | Gestational Diabetes Symptoms | Early Signs Pregnancy Diabetes
description:
High Blood Sugar in Pregnancy Signs | Gestational Diabetes Symptoms | How to Know If Sugar Is High in Pregnancy | Pregnancy Sugar Level Warning Signs | Early Signs of Pregnancy Diabetes

High Sugar Levels in Pregnancy: 6 Warning Signs You Shouldn’t Ignore

Pregnancy comes with many changes, but one thing to watch out for is high blood sugar levels. Gestational diabetes can develop even if you’ve never had diabetes before. If left unchecked, it can affect both you and your baby. Here are six early signs that your blood sugar might be too high during pregnancy.

🔹 Top 6 Signs of High Blood Sugar in Pregnancy
✔️ Excessive Thirst – Feeling constantly thirsty, even after drinking plenty of water.
✔️ Frequent Urination – Needing to pee more often, especially waking up at night to urinate.
✔️ Extreme Fatigue – Feeling unusually tired, drained, or weak despite resting well.
✔️ Blurred Vision – Sudden vision changes, such as blurriness or trouble focusing.
✔️ Increased Hunger – Feeling hungry all the time, even after eating.
✔️ Frequent Infections – More yeast infections, UTIs, or slow healing of cuts and wounds.

⭐ What to Do Next?
If you notice these signs, consult your doctor immediately. A simple glucose test can confirm if your sugar levels are high. Managing blood sugar with a healthy diet, exercise, and medical guidance can help keep you and your baby safe.

Have you experienced any of these symptoms? Let us know in the comments!

title: Symptomer diabetes
description:
Symptomer på diabetes varierer, både i rekkefølge og styrke. Generelt er symptomene på diabetes type 1 tydeligere enn ved diabetes type 2. Dette er de mest vanlige symptomene på diabetes:

• Trøtt og sliten: Fordi kroppen ikke tar opp energien fra mat og drikke
• Økt vannlating: Man tisser oftere fordi kroppen prøver å kvitte seg med det høye blodsukkeret. 
• Tørste: Økt vannlating fører igjen til økt tørste grunnet dehydrering. 
• Vektnedgang: Næringen fra mat og drikke tas ikke opp i kroppen, og kroppen vil da bruke fettceller som forbrenning. En annen årsak til vektnedgang er stort væsketap pga økt vannlating/økt diurese. 

Det finnes også mange andre symptomer på diabetes som ikke er så vanlige som de som vises i filmen. Ved diabetes type 1 vil man fortere bli alvorlig syk, mens ved diabetes type 2 kan man ha sykdommen lenge uten å oppdage det på grunn av svake symptomer. 
Det er enkelt å finne ut om man har diabetes ved å måle blodsukkeret hos legen.

Denne videoen er utviklet med økonomisk støtte fra Damstiftelsen.

title: Diabetes Treatment || Dr Biswaroop Roy Chowdhury
description:
Join this channel to get access to perks:
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCk2MflaDb9D46GQtmBo9N-Q/join

डॉ बिस्वरूप के साथ डायबिटीज की सच्चाई जानें || Diabetes 
Diabetes is a chronic disease that occurs when your blood sugar levels are too high. It happens when your body doesn't produce enough insulin, or when your cells don't respond to insulin properly. 
Symptoms 
Increased thirst
Frequent urination
Unintentional weight loss
Ketones in your urine
Fatigue
Mood changes
Blurry vision
Slow-healing sores
Infections
Complications 
Eye problems, including cataracts and glaucoma
Kidney damage, which can lead to dialysis or a kidney transplant
Nerve damage, which can cause pain, tingling, numbness, and difficulty digesting food
Heart disease, including heart attack and stroke
Skin problems, including bacterial and fungal infections
Hearing impairment
Sleep apnea
Dementia
Types of diabetes 
Type 1 diabetes
Also known as juvenile diabetes, this type occurs when the pancreas doesn't produce enough insulin. It can start at any age, but often begins in childhood or the teenage years.
Type 2 diabetes
This is the most common type of diabetes and usually affects adults. It occurs when the body becomes resistant to insulin.
Treatment
There's no cure for diabetes, but it can be managed with diet, exercise, and medication. 
Diagnosis
A healthcare provider can diagnose diabetes with a blood test that measures your glucose level.

title: Top 3 Vitamins Every Diabetic MUST Take! (Lower Blood Sugar)
description:
Top 3 Vitamins Every Diabetic MUST Take! (Lower Blood Sugar)

Managing diabetes isn’t just about cutting carbs and taking medications—diabetics need the right nutrients to truly control blood sugar and prevent complications. Many diabetics are unknowingly defVitamin D, Vitamin B12, and Folate (B9), which play essential roles in insulin function, nerve health, and inflammation control. Without these nutrients, diabetics may experience worsening neuropathy, fatigue, and higher risks of heart and kidney disease. Addressing these deficiencies can improve energy levels, reduce nerve pain, and support overall health. The right vitamins don’t replace medications, but they enhance the body’s ability to heal and regulate itself naturally. Every diabetic should focus on replenishing these essential nutrients through diet and supplementation to live a healthier, more vibrant life.

title: Top 10 Best Breakfasts Every Diabetic Must Know! Best Breakfast For A Diabetic
description:
Top 10 Best Breakfasts Every Diabetic Must Know! Best Breakfast For A Diabetic

Starting your day with the right breakfast is crucial for diabetics who want to maintain stable blood sugar levels and avoid energy crashes. Many people make the mistake of consuming high-carb, processed foods in the morning, which can lead to dangerous glucose spikes. However, there are plenty of delicious and nutritious options that help diabetics stay full and energized without compromising their health. From protein-packed eggs and fiber-rich oatmeal to Greek yogurt with berries and low-carb smoothies, these meals provide a balanced combination of protein, healthy fats, and slow-digesting carbohydrates. For diabetics, making smart food choices in the morning can set the tone for the entire day, promoting better insulin sensitivity and long-term well-being. Choosing whole foods, nutrient-dense ingredients, and avoiding added sugars are key strategies that all diabetics should incorporate into their daily routine. By prioritizing healthy breakfasts, diabetics can take control of their diet, improve their overall health, and enjoy meals that are both satisfying and beneficial.

If you found this information helpful, don’t forget to like, subscribe, and comment below! Share your favorite diabetic-friendly breakfast and let us know how you manage your morning meals! 🚀💬

title: Type 1 diabetes | Control diabetes without medicine | Sugar control tips | The Health Show
description:
Type 1 diabetes, once known as juvenile diabetes or insulin-dependent diabetes, is a chronic condition. In this condition, the pancreas makes little or no insulin. Insulin is a hormone the body uses to allow sugar (glucose) to enter cells to produce energy.

Different factors, such as genetics and some viruses, may cause type 1 diabetes. Although type 1 diabetes usually appears during childhood or adolescence, it can develop in adults.

Even after a lot of research, type 1 diabetes has no cure. Treatment is directed toward managing the amount of sugar in the blood using insulin, diet and lifestyle to prevent complications.

title: Is Type-2 Diabetes Reversible ? #drkmsaifullah #diabetesmanagement
description:
Is Type -2 Diabetes Reversible?
In this video, Dr.K.M.Saifullah a World-Renowned Ayush Chikitsak discusses the fascinating topic of Type-2 diabetes and explores how it can be reversed in certain conditions. While 
Type-2 diabetes is indeed reversible, it's important to understand that this doesn't mean you can indulge in sugary foods without consequences. Reversing Type-2 diabetes means achieving better control over your health, to the point where you may no longer need to rely on medication. However, this can only be achieved through consistent discipline in lifestyle choices, including proper diet and exercise.

To successfully reverse Type-2 diabetes, we first need to understand its causes. Dr.K.M.Saifullah highlights key factors such as constant high stress, accumulation of toxins, and chronic inflammation, all of which play a significant role in the development and progression of the disease. Watch as Dr. Saifullah shares valuable insights on managing and potentially reversing Type-2 diabetes the right way.

Can Diabetes Cause Paralysis? in Telugu || Dr. Deepthi Kareti
description:
Why does diabetes cause paralysis?
Diabetic neuropathy, which is nerve damage caused by high blood sugar levels, can also cause muscle weakness or even paralysis in extreme cases. Furthermore, stroke risk is notably higher in individuals with diabetes.

Can you live a long life with diabetes?
Life expectancy is known as the number of years a person is expected to live. At age 50, life expectancy is 6 years shorter for people with type 2 diabetes than for people without diabetes. By meeting type 2 diabetes treatment goals, life expectancy can increase by 3 years, or for some, as much as 10 years.

Does diabetes damage nerves?
Diabetes can affect nerves that control movement, sensation and other functions. If you have diabetes, you can develop nerve problems at any time. Sometimes, neuropathy can be the first sign of diabetes. Significant nerve problems (clinical neuropathy) can develop within the first 10 years after a diabetes diagnosis.

What is end stage diabetes?
End-stage diabetes is a term for the advanced complications that can develop after many years of living with diabetes. These complications can include heart disease, kidney problems, and nerve damage.

title: Makanan Yang Bagus Untuk Diabetes atau kencing manis
description:
Pilihan makanan yang baik untuk diabetes
Makanan mengandung glukosa yang akan berguna bagi tubuh sebagai sumber energi.
 Nah, semua makanan dan minuman yang dikonsumsi umumnya akan memengaruhi kadar gula darah dalam tubuh.

Sebagai penderita diabetes, Anda tentu perlu memperhatikan makanan yang masuk agar gula darah tetap stabil dan terhindar dari komplikasi diabetes.

Selain menghindari pantangan makanan diabetes yang tinggi gula, Anda juga perlu tahu makanan apa yang sebaiknya Anda konsumsi. Umumnya, diabetesi dianjurkan untuk mengonsumsi makanan yang memiliki indeks glikemik rendah.

Indeks glikemik (IG) adalah ukuran yang menunjukkan seberapa cepat makanan dapat meningkatkan gula darah dalam tubuh. Makanan dengan indeks glikemik rendah berarti membutuhkan waktu lebih lama untuk diproses menjadi glukosa di dalam tubuh. Dengan begitu, gula darah akan cenderung relatif stabil.

title: Unlocking the Mystery of Type 1 Diabetes – The TEDDY & Cascade Studies with Michael Killian
description:
In this episode, Dr. Steve Edelman sits down with Michael Killian, Director of Clinical Services at Pacific Northwest Research Institute, to discuss two groundbreaking studies—TEDDY and Cascade—that have shaped our understanding of genetic and environmental triggers for type 1 diabetes. The TEDDY study, spanning over 20 years and involving nearly 8,800 participants, investigates why some genetically at-risk individuals develop type 1 diabetes while others do not. Cascade builds upon TEDDY’s findings, aiming to integrate early screening into standard healthcare and identify potential preventative interventions. Michael and Dr. Edelman break down the major findings of these studies, including the role of viruses, genetics, and immune responses, and what they mean for the future of type 1 diabetes prevention and treatment.

Key Topics:
What is the TEDDY Study, and why is it so important?
Can genetics alone determine who will develop type 1 diabetes?
How do environmental factors influence the onset of type 1 diabetes?
Do certain viruses trigger autoimmune attacks on beta cells?
What did TEDDY reveal about the timing of early autoimmunity?
Can diet or probiotics help lower the risk of type 1 diabetes?
What is the Cascade Study, and how does it build on TEDDY’s research?
How does newborn screening for type 1 diabetes risk work?
Could vitamin D, Omega-3s, or other supplements slow or prevent type 1 diabetes?
What’s next in research for type 1 diabetes prevention and treatment?

✨ Subscribe for must-know updates, advocacy news, and technology breakthroughs that empower people with diabetes to live longer, healthier, and happier lives. Let's stay informed and take control together!

title: 8 Common Diabetes SIGNS In Women! #shorts #diabetessymptoms #diabetes
description:
Are you experiencing unusual symptoms and wondering if they might be linked to diabetes? In this video, we’ll reveal the 8 common diabetes signs in women that you should never ignore! Diabetes doesn’t always come with clear warning signs, especially for women. It can be sneaky, blending into your daily life with symptoms that are easy to overlook. But recognizing these signs early can make a world of difference in managing your health.

The first sign to look out for is frequent urination and thirst. If you’re constantly feeling thirsty or running to the bathroom more than usual, it could be your body’s way of signaling high blood sugar levels. Next on the list is yeast infections. Women with diabetes are more prone to recurrent infections due to elevated blood glucose.

Another crucial sign is polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS), which is closely linked to insulin resistance and can significantly increase your risk of diabetes. Similarly, unexplained weight changes—whether rapid loss or difficulty losing weight—can also hint at blood sugar issues.

Feeling constantly tired or drained? Fatigue is a common yet often overlooked symptom of diabetes in women. Additionally, slow healing of wounds is a warning sign that your body is struggling to repair itself, possibly due to high glucose levels.

One of the most concerning symptoms is numbness or tingling in your hands and feet. This could indicate diabetic neuropathy, a complication arising from prolonged high blood sugar. Lastly, don’t ignore skin changes, such as dry, itchy skin or dark patches in body folds, as they can also be linked to diabetes.

Knowing these diabetes symptoms in women is the first step towards proactive health management. If you notice any of these signs, it’s crucial to seek medical advice for early diagnosis and effective diabetes management. Taking timely action can help you maintain better control over your blood sugar levels and lead a healthier, more balanced life.

Stay informed and empowered by subscribing to our channel for more health tips and insights! If you found this video helpful, don’t forget to like and share it with others who might benefit. Your support means a lot to us!

description:
¡7 PRINCIPALES SIGNOS de DIABETES en la PIEL! (aparece si tienes DEMASIADA AZÚCAR en la sangre): una advertencia para quienes tienen prediabetes, diabetes o resistencia a la insulina.

La diabetes es una peligrosa enfermedad, que puede ser mortal. Pero no todas son malas noticias, ya que si la detectas precozmente puede ser curada o revertida por completo. 

En este video te muestro los síntomas más comunes de diabetes que aparecen en la piel cuando tienes el azúcar muy alto en la sangre. 

Estas manifestaciones son las primeras que surgen en los pacientes con diabetes tipo 2, o incluso en etapas tempranas, antes que la prediabetes se transforme en diabetes. 

También te explicaré cuáles de estos signos y síntomas cutáneos indican que tu diabetes está más avanzada o ya tienes alguna complicación, como daño en tus nervios (neuropatía), insuficiencia renal (nefropatía) o daño en tus ojos (retinopatía). Además, te doy consejos médicos para controlar tu diabetes y mejorar tu salud.

title: Top 5 BEST Meats For Diabetes You SHOULD Eat! ( Lower Blood Sugar )
description:
Top 5 BEST Meats For Diabetes You SHOULD Eat! ( Lower Blood Sugar )

If you're **diabetics**, making the right food choices is essential for maintaining stable blood sugar levels and overall health. Choosing lean, high-protein meats can help manage blood glucose while providing essential nutrients that support metabolic function. For **diabetics**, some of the best meat options include skinless chicken breast, salmon, pork tenderloin, turkey breast, and nutrient-rich organ meats. These choices are not only delicious but also beneficial for insulin sensitivity and cardiovascular health. 
By including these meats in a well-balanced diet, **diabetics** can enjoy satisfying meals while keeping their blood sugar levels in check. Skinless chicken breast and turkey breast provide lean protein without unhealthy fats, while salmon offers heart-healthy omega-3s that reduce inflammation. Pork tenderloin and organ meats contribute essential vitamins and minerals that promote overall well-being for **diabetics**.

title: ¡SEÑALES de ALARMA de DIABETES en la NOCHE!| PRIMEROS SÍNTOMAS de DIABETES
description:
¡No ignores estos síntomas que indican que tienes la glucemia muy alta de noche!
La diabetes es una peligrosa enfermedad, pero puede ser revertida y tiene cura con cambios saludables en tu estilo de vida, sobre todo cuando es detectada a tiempo, en etapa temprana. Muchas personas padecen de diabetes y no lo saben, porque los síntomas se confunden con otros problemas de salud. 

La diabetes es una condición en la cual el cuerpo no produce suficiente insulina, o hay resistencia a la insulina provocando azúcar muy alta en sangre (glucemia elevada). 

En este video te cuento los primeros signos y síntomas de diabetes que se manifiestan de noche y al dormir por tener la glucosa muy alta en sangre. También te explico las complicaciones que pueden aparecer cuando no se controla la diabetes y tienes la glucemia muy elevada.

Tener la glucosa alta de noche puede causar síntomas como aumento de la frecuencia para orinar (nocturia), tener mucha sed excesiva de noche, boca seca, calambres en las piernas y pies, hormigueos o entumecimiento en los pies. 
El síndrome de las piernas inquietas también puede ser una manifestación de diabetes en etapa temprana. 

Pesadillas y terrores nocturos, insomnio y apnea del sueño también son formas que la diabetes se manifiesta de noche. 

Conocer estos síntomas puede hacer que detectes la diabetes en etapa precoz, y puedas tratarla a tiempo para evitar sus complicaciones como la neuropatía. 

Existen remedios caseros y naturales para la diabetes muy efectivos:
-Vinagre de manzana orgánico con la madre: puedes tomar 1 cucharada diluido en agua todos los días en ayunas y antes de dormir. Esto ayuda a controlar los niveles de glucosa elevada en sangre y mejorar los picos de insulina. 
-Jugo de remolacha (betabel): tomar 250ml todos los días es excelente para mejorar la inflamación y la resistencia a la insulina, sobre todo cuando lo acompañas de ejercicio físico. 
-Jugo de granada: tomar 250ml o consumir una granada todos los días por 3-4 semanas mostró reducir la glucemia elevada. 

Video con fines educativos. 

00:00 Síntomas más frecuentes de diabetes en la noche
01:00 Número 1: orinar mucho de noche (nocturia)
03:22 Número 2: visión borrosa en la noche
04:16 Número 3: tener mucha sed de noche
05:13 Número 4: calambres en las piernas de noche
07:22 Número 5: Pesadillas y terrores nocturnos
08:26 Número 6: Piernas inquietas de noche y entumecimiento en los pies 
09:29 Número 7: apnea del sueño
10:33 1 cucharada de vinagre de manzana por día baja la glucosa en sangre
12:00 Qué tomar para controlar la diabetes: los mejores jugos naturales

Libro recomendado: "El superpoder de los alimentos"
